column4: Hello, how do I permanently unhide a folder? The folder name does not begin with a dot (.), strangely.
I don't even know how to hide a folder without using the dot thing.. what file system are you using?
It's in an ext3 partition.
But I downloaded the file from a torrent, so it may have been a hidden folder on a Windows box.
and this folder.. it doesn't show up in nautilus? or how do you mean "hidden"
It shows only when I Ctrl+H to unhide folders.
and there is no dot
that's very very odd...
The folder icon, however, is slightly dimmed like all the other hidden folders (which do have a dot prefix).
Any ideas on how to unhide this folder? None of the files within it have a dot prefix either.
can you do a ls -la in the parent folder and pastebin it?
What's odd is that in a console, it shows up without the -a flag.
It shows up even with a normal ls.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63361/
bah.. sorry.. I meant ls -la
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63362/
hah.. I just renamed a folder to that very name.. and now it's hidden too.. might be something with the "~" in the folder name
Oh that is very odd. Thanks, the problem is now fixed!
but now we've got a new problem.. why on earth does nautilus hide folders containing a ~ .. is that standard behaviour???
Hmm.. no idea :/
That's worthy of a bug report, I think.
